item.title: Man Utd fight back again but Arsenal extend unbeaten run in four-goal thriller - Daily Monitor
item.description:
Man Utd fight back again but Arsenal extend unbeaten run in four-goal thriller  Daily Monitor

Jose Mourinho accused his Manchester United players of shooting themselves in the foot as he saw his under-strength team gift Arsenal two goals in a 2-2 draw ...

item.title: Arsenal vs Huddersfield LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, odds and predictions - The Independent
item.description:
Arsenal vs Huddersfield LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, odds and predictions  The Independent

Arsenal will be hoping to extend their unbeaten run to 21 games when they entertain Huddersfield Town in North London. Unai Emery’s side threw the lead away twice in midweek to draw with Manchester United but it saw them take four points from a tough week of fixtures after their victory over Tottenham. David Wagner’s outfit looked to have turned a corner with a 2-0 win at Wolves at the end of last month but have lost both their games since against Brighton and Bournemouth, and they face another tall order here. What time does it start? Arsenal vs Huddersfield Town kicks off at 3pm (GMT) Fan...

item.title: Arsenal vs Huddersfield, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction? - The Telegraph
item.description:
Arsenal vs Huddersfield, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction?  The Telegraph

What is it? It is Arsenal vs Huddersfield in the Premier League - the 16th league match for each side this season. When is it? It's today, so Saturday December 8. What time is kick-off? It is a 3pm GMT start at the Emirates. What TV channel is it on? Unfortunately in the UK, it is not, because of the 3pm TV blackout. Highlights will be on Match of the Day at 10.20pm on BBC One. Alternatively, you can follow the game live here. Rob Holding is out for nine months with injuryCredit: Reuters What is the team news? Arsenal: Defender Rob Holding is out of Arsenal's Premier League clash with Hudde...

item.title: Premier League bets: Manchester City will inflict more pain on Chelsea - The Telegraph
item.description:
Premier League bets: Manchester City will inflict more pain on Chelsea  The Telegraph

After you have lost your unbeaten record with a disappointing performance against one of your huge rivals and suffered another defeat on the road against Wolves after letting a lead slip, the last team you want rolling into town is Manchester City. Maurizio Sarri’s decision to rest Jorginho, Mateo Kovacic, David Luiz and Pedro failed to pay off against Wolves but his side were still unlucky to lose 2-1, given their opponents scored with their only two shots on target. Chelsea are unbeaten at home this season but have drawn three of their eight matches at Stamford Bridge against Liverpool, M...

item.title: Claude Puel hatches plan to keep Leicester’s best players at the club by matching their ambitions - The Independent
item.description:
Claude Puel hatches plan to keep Leicester’s best players at the club by matching their ambitions  The Independent

Leicester City boss Claude Puel admits the Foxes need European football to match his stars’ ambitions. The club are ninth in the Premier League and poised to battle for a Europa League spot this season. Arsenal have been linked with England international Ben Chilwell while Manchester United wanted Harry Maguire in the summer before the defender signed a five-year deal in September. But Puel conceded, before Saturday’s visit of Tottenham Hotspur, Leicester need to play in Europe to have a better chance of keeping the squad together. “I think it would be better, of course,” said the manager, ...

item.title: Fantasy football picks and scout tips gameweek 16: Alexandre Lacazette, Trent Alexander-Arnold and more - The Independent
item.description:
Fantasy football picks and scout tips gameweek 16: Alexandre Lacazette, Trent Alexander-Arnold and more  The Independent

Alexandre Lacazette Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was very much the flavour of the week, seeing more price rises than points, and remains an excellent choice ahead of this weekend's meeting with Huddersfield Town. At £1.6m cheaper, however, Alexandre Lacazette should not be ignored, especially if he is restored to the starting line-up for Arsenal's forthcoming run of favourable fixtures. Lacazette scored in the north London derby and was a shade unlucky not to be awarded Marcos Rojo's goal at Old Trafford on Wednesday night. Lukasz Fabianski Even with just one clean sheet in his last nine outin...

item.title: Rob Holding reveals get-well message from Marcus Rashford after Arsenal defender’s knee injury - The Independent
item.description:
Rob Holding reveals get-well message from Marcus Rashford after Arsenal defender’s knee injury  The Independent

Rob Holding has revealed that Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford has messaged him in the wake of receiving news that his season is over, having suffered a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament in a challenge by the England international. Holding collapsed midway through the first half of Arsenal’s 2-2 draw at Old Trafford on Wednesday and had to be carried off on a stretcher with his left leg in a brace, with scans revealing the worst on Friday. The 23-year-old is set to be out of action for up to nine months, ruling him out of the rest of the season and potentially that start of the 2...

item.title: Arsenal vs Huddersfield: Unai Emery must decide when to rest senior players as fixtures come thick and fast - The Independent
item.description:
Arsenal vs Huddersfield: Unai Emery must decide when to rest senior players as fixtures come thick and fast  The Independent

This week last year, with an important Champions League match against Bayern Munich looming large on the horizon, Paris Saint-Germain manager Unai Emery decided to shuffle his pack. For the long journey to struggling Strasbourg’s Stade de la Meinau, Emery boldly dropped Edinson Cavani to the bench. Marco Verratti, too. Club captain Thiago Silva did not even make the squad. Strasbourg gratefully snatched at their chance. Goals from Nuno da Costa and Stephane Bahoken saw them run out unlikely 2-1 winners, rising to fourteenth in the Ligue 1 table. It was PSG’s first defeat of the season – and...

item.title: Leicester vs Tottenham, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction? - The Telegraph
item.description:
Leicester vs Tottenham, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction?  The Telegraph

What is it? A Premier League game pitting Leicester City against Tottenham Hotspur. When is it? It's today, so Saturday 8 December. What time is kick-off? This is the (very) late game on Saturday - kick-off is at 7.45pm. What TV channel is it on? You can watch this one on BT Sport 1. Or follow the game with us on this page. What is the team news?Leicester Leicester have been dealt a blow with the news that Jamie Vardy is out of Saturday's game with the groin injury that meant he missed the draw at Fulham in midweek. In better news Jonny Evans should be back in the squad. Harry Maguire will ...

item.title: Unai Emery: ‘Arsenal are conceding more goals than we want’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Unai Emery: ‘Arsenal are conceding more goals than we want’  The Guardian

This time last year Unai Emery came to the end of a 25-match unbeaten run with Paris Saint-Germain but the manager says he cannot remember a thing about it as he seeks to extend Arsenal’s 20-game streak against Huddersfield. Related: Lucas Torreira caps Arsenal’s comeback in 4-2 derby win over 10-man Spurs After a thrilling triumph against Tottenham and a solid point at Old Trafford, Arsenal came down to earth with news the defender Rob Holding will be out for the season through injury and a tabloid exposé that showed several players apparently taking nitrous oxide. Emery’s focus, however, ...

item.title: Premier League LIVE - Latest scores and goal updates from Arsenal vs Huddersfield, Manchester United vs Fulham - The Independent
item.description:
Premier League LIVE - Latest scores and goal updates from Arsenal vs Huddersfield, Manchester United vs Fulham  The Independent

Follow all the latest from today’s Premier League action on a bumper day of eight games, with all the goals and updates as they happen. Once Bournemouth vs Liverpool wraps up in the day’s early kick-off, Arsenal host Huddersfield at the Emirates looking to record a 21st consecutive unbeaten result. Manchester United are also in action at 3pm as they welcome Claudio Ranieri's Fulham to Old Trafford, with Jose Mourinho's side in desperate need of a win after four league games without victory. Burnley will look to try and climb out of the relegation zone as they face Brighton at Turf Moor, whi...

item.title: Arsenal news: Rob Holding out for up to nine months with ruptured ACL, club confirm - The Independent
item.description:
Arsenal news: Rob Holding out for up to nine months with ruptured ACL, club confirm  The Independent

Arsenal defender Rob Holding has ruptured the anterior cruciate ligament of his left knee and will miss the remainder of the 2018/19 season, the club confirmed on Friday. Holding was taken off on a stretcher during the first-half of Arsenal’s 2-2 draw with Manchester United at Old Trafford on Wednesday, having broken into the first-team under Unai Emery this season. The 23-year-old was taken back to London for tests following the collision with Marcus Rashford, with scans revealing he had ruptured the anterior cruciate ligament of his left knee. “Rob will undergo surgery to repair this in t...

item.title: Bournemouth vs Liverpool, Premier League: live score and latest updates - The Telegraph
item.description:
Bournemouth vs Liverpool, Premier League: live score and latest updates  The Telegraph

1:00PM30 mins Bournemouth have responded well. Stanislas and Daniels combine well down the left, but the former's cross is poor and the move breaks down. 12:58PMGOOOAAAAL!! Bournemouth 0 Liverpool 1 (Salah)! Begovic is at fault here... and so is the linesman! Firmino volleys a hugely ambitious left-footed effort at goal, and it looks like a simple enough save for Begovic, who should really palm it out of harm's way. He only succeeds in swatting it straight out in front of his goal, though, and Salah - who replays show was clearly offside - follows up to score from eight yards. The Egyptian ...

item.title: Premier League clubs' Rainbow Laces posts draw homophobic responses - The Guardian
item.description:
Premier League clubs' Rainbow Laces posts draw homophobic responses  The Guardian

Premier League football teams including Manchester United, Arsenal and Chelsea have received thousands of homophobic responses on social media for showing solidarity with Stonewall’s pro-LGBT Rainbow Laces campaign. Over the past two weeks the clubs have been posting pictures on social media of rainbow-striped logos and messages to back the annual campaign, which was launched by Stonewall in 2013 to kick out homophobia in football. A post on Manchester United’s Facebook page in support of the campaign received more than 43,000 “angry” responses. Fans’ comments including “Say No to LGBT”, “G...

item.title: Arsenal to talk to players seen apparently inhaling nitrous oxide - The Guardian
item.description:
Arsenal to talk to players seen apparently inhaling nitrous oxide  The Guardian

Arsenal have responded to footage showing some of their players apparently inhaling nitrous oxide in a London nightclub by saying those involved will be spoken to and reminded of their responsibilities. A number of players, including Mesut Özil, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, Alexandre Lacazette and Mattéo Guendouzi, appear to inhale nitrous oxide – also referred to as laughing gas or hippy crack – in footage published by the Sun. Related: Arsenal’s Unai Emery tells Mattéo Guendouzi: get your hair cut The incident is reported to have taken place in August, before the start of the season. A club...

item.title: Arsenal team news: Unai Emery set to return to back four after Rob Holding injury while Mesut Ozil misses again - The Independent
item.description:
Arsenal team news: Unai Emery set to return to back four after Rob Holding injury while Mesut Ozil misses again  The Independent

Mesut Ozil is expected to miss his fifth successive match with backache as Arsenal host Huddersfield on Saturday in the Premier League. Aaron Ramsey is also a doubt after coming off at half-time in Arsenal’s 2-2 draw with Manchester United on Wednesday with an ankle injury. However, Granit Xhaka will return from suspension to reinforce Unai Emery’s midfield. Arsenal confirmed today that Rob Holding will be out for six to nine months after the centre-back suffered a rupture to his anterior cruciate ligament at Old Trafford, which caused him to be stretchered off during the first-half. Howeve...

item.title: Tottenham’s Danny Rose: playing at Wembley no longer feels like an honour - The Guardian
item.description:
Tottenham’s Danny Rose: playing at Wembley no longer feels like an honour  The Guardian

Danny Rose says it is no longer an honour to play at Wembley as he laid bare the frustration of Tottenham players with the club’s delayed new stadium and their unsatisfactory stop-gap accommodation. Spurs will continue to play their home matches at Wembley until at least the end of the month – with the suggestion being it could be February before they get into the rebuilt White Hart Lane – and there was a low point on Wednesday when only 33,012 turned up to see them beat Southampton 3-1. Related: UK betting firms back live sports advertising ban The club’s previous lowest league attendance ...

item.title: Liverpool and Manchester City are bringing rhythmic tension to the Premier League - The Independent
item.description:
Liverpool and Manchester City are bringing rhythmic tension to the Premier League  The Independent

Already this weekend there is something of a twist to the Premier League. For the first time since early November, Liverpool will play before Manchester City, changing the dynamics that have governed the top of the table for the last month. The fact that Jurgen Klopp’s side have always been under such pressure to follow the champions with a win, to keep the gap at just two points, has been one big reason why it has felt they have been just about “hanging on” – despite having already been responsible for the seventh best record after 15 games in English history. It has just added that extra ...

item.title: Jürgen Klopp admits Ben Mee tackle was ‘clean’ but bemoans rash sliding in - The Guardian
item.description:
Jürgen Klopp admits Ben Mee tackle was ‘clean’ but bemoans rash sliding in  The Guardian

Jürgen Klopp has said Ben Mee did not intentionally injure Joe Gomez and the challenge that fractured the Liverpool defender’s leg was “the cleanest” committed by Burnley at Turf Moor. Related: Liverpool’s Joe Gomez suffers leg fracture but Sean Dyche defends tackles Klopp and Sean Dyche were embroiled in an angry exchange following Liverpool’s 3-1 win on Wednesday, with the Burnley manager annoyed by criticism of his players’ tackling. The Liverpool manager asked referee Stuart Attwell to take action over challenges that he believes were rash, but accepted were not fouls. That prompted Dyc...

item.title: Bournemouth vs Liverpool, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction? - The Telegraph
item.description:
Bournemouth vs Liverpool, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction?  The Telegraph

What is it? It's the opening match of the 16th round of Premier League fixtures - seventh-placed AFC Bournemouth host unbeaten Liverpool in second. Liverpool have won five of these sides' six league meetings but two years ago Eddie Howe's side fought back from 3-1 down with 14 minutes to play to win a thriller 4-3 at the Vitality Stadium, which will always be known as Dean Court to people of a certain age and sensible disposititions. When is it? It's today, so Saturday, December 8. What time is kick-off? 12.30pm. Newsletter Promotion - Chris Bascombe's Liverpool briefingWhat TV channel is i...

item.title: No laughing matter: Arsenal to speak to players after ‘hippy crack’ video emerges - RT
item.description:
No laughing matter: Arsenal to speak to players after ‘hippy crack’ video emerges  RT

Arsenal football club has said it will speak to several star players after footage emerged apparently showing them taking nitrous oxide – also known as ‘hippy crack’ – at a lavish party in London earlier this year. The Sun newspaper released CCTV footage on Friday which allegedly shows a group of Arsenal stars – including midfielder Mesut Ozil and striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang – inhaling nitrous oxide from balloons at a £30,000 “champagne and vodka party” attended by around 70 women at the exclusive Tape club in London’s West End. According to the newspaper, the group of Gunners players...

item.title: Jose Mourinho pleads for FFP to help Manchester United catch Manchester City if they are to win the league again - The Independent
item.description:
Jose Mourinho pleads for FFP to help Manchester United catch Manchester City if they are to win the league again  The Independent

Jose Mourinho has claimed that Manchester United may need authorities to crack down on Manchester City’s spending before they can hope to challenge their rivals for the Premier League title again. Uefa last month opened an investigation into allegations, published in the German magazine Der Spiegel, that City illegitimately circumvented Financial Fair Play (FFP) regulations. Mourinho has regularly complained that United cannot match City’s clout in the transfer market since his arrival in Manchester and pointed to City’s spending power as a reason why United struggle to compete with their n...

item.title: Mauricio Pochettino: ‘If you look at our budgets Spurs are the same as Leicester’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Mauricio Pochettino: ‘If you look at our budgets Spurs are the same as Leicester’  The Guardian

Mauricio Pochettino has admitted Leicester are on Tottenham’s level when it comes to investment but insists money is not everything when it comes to competing at the top end of the Premier League. Related: Leicester City v Tottenham: match preview After bouncing back from a derby defeat against Arsenal with a midweek win over Southampton, Spurs travel to the King Power stadium on Saturday night. They could be 11 points behind the leaders Manchester City by the time they kick off but Tottenham are also eight points better off than they were this time last season and their manager believes ti...

item.title: Arsenal defender Rob Holding out for the season with knee ligament injury - The Telegraph
item.description:
Arsenal defender Rob Holding out for the season with knee ligament injury  The Telegraph

Arsenal defender Rob Holding will miss the rest of the season after rupturing his anterior cruciate ligament, the club have confirmed. Holding was stretchered off in the first half of Arsenal's 2-2 draw with Manchester United on Wednesday, with a knee problem head coach Unai Emery described as a 'big injury'. The former Bolton Wanderers defender will undergo surgery in the coming days and will begin a rehabilitation programme expected to take between six and nine months. Arsenal added: "Everyone at the club will now be working as hard as we can to ensure Rob is back on the pitch as soon as ...

item.title: Jay Rodriguez admits scoring late equaliser for West Brom against Aston Villa with hand - The Telegraph
item.description:
Jay Rodriguez admits scoring late equaliser for West Brom against Aston Villa with hand  The Telegraph

West Brom 2 Aston Villa 2 Aston Villa were controversially denied maximum points as Darren England, the referee, allowed a Jay Rodriguez stoppage-time equaliser to stand after the West Bromwich Albion striker had clearly bundled the ball into the net with his hands. The South Yorkshire official consulted his assistant on the line in response to vehement protests by goalkeeper Orjan Nyland and his team-mates but did not reverse his decision, leaving Villa with a sense of injustice that replays showed was understandable. Diving in to meet a Matt Phillips cross, with Albion throwing everything...

item.title: Bournemouth vs Liverpool LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, odds and predictions - The Independent
item.description:
Bournemouth vs Liverpool LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, odds and predictions  The Independent

Liverpool have the opportunity to leapfrog Manchester City and go top of the table for a few hours at least when they meet seventh-placed Bournemouth. The Reds are yet to taste league defeat this season and will be confident of a win which could would them to the summit of the Premier League before Pep Guardiola’s side face a difficult task at Chelsea. Bournemouth however ended a run of four straight defeats in a 2-1 win over Huddersfield in midweek, with in-form Callum Wilson notching his eighth of the season. Follow the live action below. What time does it start? Bournemouth vs Liverpool ...

item.title: Arsenal players accused of passing out after reportedly inhaling 'hippy crack' at party - The Telegraph
item.description:
Arsenal players accused of passing out after reportedly inhaling 'hippy crack' at party  The Telegraph

A string of senior Arsenal players were embroiled in a “hippy crack” storm on Thursday night after it was reported they had inhaled nitrous oxide at a pre-season party. Alexandre Lacazette, Mesut Ozil, Matteo Guendouzi and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang were all pictured at the event, at which so-called “hippy crack” was reportedly inhaled from balloons. The Sun reported that the party took place in London in August, before the start of the Premier League season. The newspaper reported on Thursday night that boxes of “hippy crack” or “laughing gas” canisters were brought to the players in a priv...

item.title: Liverpool’s Joe Gomez suffers leg fracture but Sean Dyche defends tackles - The Guardian
item.description:
Liverpool’s Joe Gomez suffers leg fracture but Sean Dyche defends tackles  The Guardian

Liverpool’s Joe Gomez will be out until the new year with a fracture of the lower left leg after crashing into the perimeter wall at Turf Moor on Wednesday. Related: Liverpool hot on City’s heels after James Milner sparks fightback at Burnley Playing at right-back, Gomez was racing down the touchline in an attacking position when a sliding tackle from Ben Mee took the ball cleanly but followed through to bring down the Liverpool player, who skidded over the dead ball line and into an advertising hoarding. Gomez was treated pitchside but was in obvious pain and ended up being carried off on ...

item.title: Arsenal news: Club to ‘remind players of their responsibilities’ after nitrous oxide video surfaces - The Independent
item.description:
Arsenal news: Club to ‘remind players of their responsibilities’ after nitrous oxide video surfaces  The Independent

Arsenal have said they will “remind players of their responsibilities” after a video emerged which showed several of their players inhaling nitrous oxide in a London nightclub. Mesut Ozil, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, Alexandre Lacazette and Matteo Guendouzi were all pictured at the pre-season party, in CCTV footage published by The Sun. Other players shown in the video, including first-team regular Henrik Mkhitaryan, can be seen rejecting the offer to inhale the gas. A club spokesperson said: “The players will be spoken to about this and reminded of their responsibilities as representatives ...

item.title: Big Match Decoded: Why Chelsea must compete to win the midfield battle - The Telegraph
item.description:
Big Match Decoded: Why Chelsea must compete to win the midfield battle  The Telegraph

The big game on Saturday in the Premier League is at Stamford Bridge as Maurizio Sarri's side hosts title favourites Man City. Chelsea have fallen out of form in recent weeks and Sarri-ball isn't having quite the effect it was earlier in the season. Pep Guardiola is a master at figuring out how to stop his opponents playing their game and with City flying high in the league, could do some damage, if not end Sarris' ambitious title ambitions. Some key tactical decisions have to be made - where will the game be won and lost? How Man City are dominating games It's essential that Sarri figures ...

item.title: Man City may gamble on Sterling for Agüero but ‘won’t be banned in Europe’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Man City may gamble on Sterling for Agüero but ‘won’t be banned in Europe’  The Guardian

Manchester City travel to Chelsea not yet ready to risk Sergio Agüero as he recovers from an abductor muscle strain and with Pep Guardiola weighing up the pros and cons of using Raheem Sterling in a more central role. Related: Chelsea v Manchester City: match preview The City manager would not reveal his intended lineup but has three in-form wingers in Sterling, Riyad Mahrez and Leroy Sané, while Gabriel Jesus has so far failed to make the most of Agüero’s absence. “Raheem can play in many positions,” Guardiola said. “I prefer him on the wing but he did not always play there for Liverpool.”...

item.title: Mauricio Pochettino treasures Wembley ‘gift’ than changed his view of England after the Falklands War - The Independent
item.description:
Mauricio Pochettino treasures Wembley ‘gift’ than changed his view of England after the Falklands War  The Independent

Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino has passionately defended Wembley Stadium claiming “it is the best place in the world to play football” and even went as far as suggesting the venue helped change his impression of the English. The Argentine grew up during the Falklands conflict and did not hold particularly affectionate views of this country as a child. But Pochettino revealed it was football and Wembley who helped change his opinion and dismissed suggestions made by Danny Rose that “it was no longer an honour” to play there. Tottenham have been playing at Wembley while their new White...

item.title: Pep Guardiola: Beating Chelsea last season was catalyst for Manchester City title win - The Telegraph
item.description:
Pep Guardiola: Beating Chelsea last season was catalyst for Manchester City title win  The Telegraph

Pep Guardiola returns to Chelsea on Saturday convinced that Manchester City’s victory at Stamford Bridge last season was the moment his masterplan began to crystallise. City’s 1-0 win against the defending champions in September last year, secured by a stunning second-half goal from midfielder Kevin De Bruyne, won widespread plaudits and was one of the highlights of a remarkable 18-match winning run in the Premier League. Guardiola believes it set the tone for City’s march to the title with an unprecedented 100 points and marked a level they have since continued to reach with regularity. “L...

item.title: Manchester United vs Fulham LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, odds and prediction - The Independent
item.description:
Manchester United vs Fulham LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, odds and prediction  The Independent

Manchester United will be looking for their first league win in four games when they entertain bottom club Fulham. Jose Mourinho’s team have drawn their past three Premier League games, including 2-2 draws against both Southampton and Arsenal in the past week. Claudio Ranieri’s side meanwhile remain rooted to the bottom of the table but are just one point off Huddersfield Town in 17th and they will therefore hope to snatch something from Old Trafford. Follow the live action below. What time does it start? Manchester United vs Fulham kicks off at 3pm (GMT) Fantasy Premier League Dream Team 2...

item.title: Arsenal’s Unai Emery tells Mattéo Guendouzi: get your hair cut - The Guardian
item.description:
Arsenal’s Unai Emery tells Mattéo Guendouzi: get your hair cut  The Guardian

Unai Emery has brushed aside controversy over Mattéo Guendouzi’s hair by telling his youngster to get it cut. The French midfielder had his frizzy hair pulled straight by Marouane Fellaini during Arsenal’s 2-2 draw with Manchester United on Wednesday. The Belgian, who recently got rid of his own trademark afro, escaped punishment from the referee, Andre Marriner, and Emery believes the incident is now cut and dried. Related: Stalemate at Old Trafford and Wolves at Chelsea's door – Football Weekly Extra “I think the best thing is that he cuts his hair before the next match, then the problem ...

item.title: Leicester vs Tottenham, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more - The Independent
item.description:
Leicester vs Tottenham, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more  The Independent

Tottenham visit Leicester City this weekend looking to consolidate their third-place position in the table. Chelsea’s defeat to Wolves and Arsenal’s draw at Manchester United saw Spurs leapfrog their London rivals after a 3-1 victory over struggling Southampton. Claude Puel’s side are on a six-game unbeaten run which continued with a draw at Fulham in midweek, but they face a much tougher assignment here against a side who have won 11 of their last 15 top-flight games. What time does it start? Leicester City vs Tottenham Hotspur kicks off at 7:45pm (GMT) Fantasy Premier League Dream Team 20...

item.title: Chelsea vs Manchester City, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction? - The Telegraph
item.description:
Chelsea vs Manchester City, Premier League 2018-19: What time is kick-off today, what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction?  The Telegraph

What is it? This is the Premier League match between table-toppers Manchester City and third-placed Chelsea. Can Chelsea inflict a first defeat of the season on the reigning champions? When is it? It's today, so Saturday, December 8. What time is kick-off? 5.30pm. What TV channel is it on? The match will be shown live on BT Sport 1. Should you not have access to that channel you can follow all the action right here when this page turns into our live blog. What is the team news? Chelsea Jorginho and David Luiz are expected to return to Chelsea's starting line-up. Chelsea manager Maurizio Sar...

item.title: Southampton confirm appointment of Ralph Hasenhüttl as new manager - The Guardian
item.description:
Southampton confirm appointment of Ralph Hasenhüttl as new manager  The Guardian

Ralph Hasenhüttl has been confirmed as the manager of Southampton on a two-and-a-half-year contract, with the club hoping the appointment will enable them to recover the identity they have lost. The modern Southampton have been built on the development of players, often from their academy, shrewdness in the transfer market and attractive, front-foot football but those values appear to have been lost over the past two and a half years, since Ronald Koeman left to take over at Everton. Related: Southampton strive for surer footing after calamitous loss of their step Mauricio Pellegrino was a ...

item.title: Cautious Optimism For Arsenal Following Spurs, Manchester United Clashes - Forbes
item.description:
Cautious Optimism For Arsenal Following Spurs, Manchester United Clashes  Forbes

LONDON, ENGLAND – DECEMBER 02: Arsenal’s Alexandre Lacazette (second right) celebrates his goal with Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, Sead Kolasinac and Aaron Ramsey during the Premier League match between Arsenal FC and Tottenham Hotspur FC at the Emirates Stadium on Dec. 2, 2018 in London, United Kingdom. (Photo by Visionhaus/Getty Images) Although there are many ways it could have gone better, you’re unlikely to hear any Arsenal supporters complain about the club’s performance over the last week. The Gunners took four points from their two English Premier League matches this week, a 4-2 North ...

item.title: Disgruntled Paul Pogba asks ‘what did you expect me to say’ after Manchester United's draw with Arsenal - The Independent
item.description:
Disgruntled Paul Pogba asks ‘what did you expect me to say’ after Manchester United's draw with Arsenal  The Independent

Paul Pogba only featured for a paltry 15 minutes in Manchester United’s error-strewn draw against Arsenal on Wednesday. Having allegedly been labelled a ‘virus’ in the dressing-room by Jose Mourinho, the £89m World Cup winner was vaccinated from the starting line-up with the Manchester United manager’s pointed programme notes revealing with little subtlety that, “there isn’t space for people that are not ready to give it their all.” And as the disgruntled looking Frenchman left Old Trafford he turned to reporters, shrugged his shoulders, and said: “what did you expect me to say?” Manchester...

item.title: Matteo Guendouzi should cut his hair like Marouane Fellaini, says Unai Emery - The Telegraph
item.description:
Matteo Guendouzi should cut his hair like Marouane Fellaini, says Unai Emery  The Telegraph

Unai Emery has joked that Matteo Guendouzi should cut his extravagant hair if he wants to avoid a repeat of Wednesday’s night hair-pulling incident with Marouane Fellaini. The Arsenal midfielder was tugged back by his hair by Fellaini in the second half of the 2-2 draw at Old Trafford. Fellaini will not face any retrospective action for the foul because it was seen by Andre Marriner, who decided not to book the Manchester United midfielder. Fellaini has in fact been on the receiving end of similar treatment in the past. The Belgian, who only recently shaved his own sizeable hairdo, had his ...

item.title: Chelsea vs Manchester City LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, prediction and odds - The Independent
item.description:
Chelsea vs Manchester City LIVE - What time does it start, TV channel, team news, prediction and odds  The Independent

Maurizio Sarri will have his work cut out in his attempts to restart Chelsea’s season when they welcome unbeaten Manchester City in the late kick-off. Chelsea looked to have bounced back from their first defeat of the season against Tottenham with victory over Fulham last weekend, but a second loss quickly followed in the Midlands at Wolves in midweek. Pep Guardiola's side however have dropped just two points all season and have won their last seven top-flight games, and so will be hoping to inflict another defeat on the hosts. What time does it start? Chelsea vs Manchester City kicks off a...

item.title: Cardiff vs Southampton, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more - The Independent
item.description:
Cardiff vs Southampton, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more  The Independent

Two points separate Cardiff and Southampton ahead of their clash on Saturday afternoon. Neil Warnock’s team have grinded out crucial wins in the last few weeks against Wolves and Brighton, but lost 3-1 in midweek at West Ham; they come into this match in 16th place on 11 points. This will be Southampton’s first match with new manager Ralph Hasenhuttl in charge, and he has some work to do with a team currently languishing in the relegation zone on nine points and without a win in 11 league matches. What time does it start? Cardiff City vs Southampton kicks off at 3:00pm (GMT) on Saturday 8th...

item.title: Chelsea ambassador Katie Chapman on profound effect trip to refugee camp had on her: 'You don't realise how tough it is' - The Telegraph
item.description:
Chelsea ambassador Katie Chapman on profound effect trip to refugee camp had on her: 'You don't realise how tough it is'  The Telegraph

Former Chelsea captain Katie Chapman recalls the moment, in the Azraq refugee camp on the Jordan-Syria border in the desert outside Amman, when a boy showed her the orange tree he had made from paper. “He wanted to remember that where he’d lived in Syria, there was an orange tree,” she says. “He used to pick the oranges, and they were delicious. They invented this tree, and all the oranges hanging from it in the arts and crafts room. I was, like, ‘Oh, my God’. There were stories to every piece of artwork.” As a player, Chapman won most of the prizes it is possible to win in a glittering 22-...
